marketNews.title: Compilation of News for Today
marketNews.content: IHSG fell -0.78%. JPFA: Net Profit +124% YoY in 9M24, Exceeding Expectations.

marketNews.title: Oil Price Drop Driven by Reduced Supply Disruption Fears
marketNews.content: Brent oil price for December 2024 contracts fell -4.2% to US$72.88 in Monday (28/10) morning trading. This decline occurred after Israel's retaliatory strike on Iran last weekend did not hit the country's oil and nuclear facilities, easing concerns about oil supply disruption and wider conflict escalation. The Iranian news agency, IRNA, reported that Israel attacked several parts of military centers in Tehran, Khuzestan, and Ilam provinces.

marketNews.title: Ministry of Agriculture Clarifies Vietnamese Milk Supply for Free Nutrition Program
marketNews.content: The Head of the Public Relations and Information Bureau of the Ministry of Agriculture, Moch. Arief Cahyono, stated that they have no plans to import 1.8 million tons of milk from Vietnam to support the free nutrition program. This statement emerged after the Minister of Agriculture, Andi Amran Sulaiman, claimed on Friday (25/10) that investors from Vietnam were interested in supplying 1.8 million tons of milk for the free nutrition program. Moch. Arief clarified that what Andi meant was that the government invited Vietnamese investors to build the dairy industry in Indonesia with the aim of increasing national milk production, not to import milk products.

marketNews.title: MIND ID Explores Semiconductor Production to Support EV Ecosystem
marketNews.content: The Director of Portfolio and Business Development of MIND ID, Dilo Seno Widagdo, stated that they are exploring options with several potential partners to produce semiconductors to support the electric vehicle ecosystem. Dilo mentioned that one potential partner is the Taiwan-based cell and battery producer, Molicel, which is targeted to develop selenium into materials that form semiconductors. The selenium supply to be used can be sourced from the copper smelter owned by PT Freeport Indonesia.

marketNews.title: Vietnam's Vingroup Sets Up Fund for Southeast Asian Startups
marketNews.content: Bloomberg reported that the Vietnamese conglomerate, Vingroup JSC, has launched a $150 million fund to support technology startups across Southeast Asia focusing on various fields, including artificial intelligence, semiconductors, and cloud computing. The fund, named VinVentures, will target startups in Vietnam during the initial phase before expanding its coverage to other countries such as Singapore, Indonesia, and the Philippines.

marketNews.title: President Prabowo Wants Key IKN Buildings Ready in 4 Years
marketNews.content: The Minister of Forestry, Raja Juli Antoni, stated that President Prabowo Subianto wants the construction of government and parliamentary buildings in the Nusantara Capital (IKN) to be completed within the next 4 years. Raja also mentioned that President Prabowo hopes the inauguration of the next president and vice president in 2029 can take place in IKN. Raja's statement emerged amidst doubts that President Prabowo would continue the IKN project with the same priority scale as the Joko Widodo era, considering the State Budget also needs to fund the free nutritious meal program. IKN itself had difficulty securing foreign investment, with the first realization of foreign investment only recorded in September 2024 when the Chinese property company, Delonix Group, injected 500 billion rupiah to build a hotel and office.

marketNews.title: BEI Announces Major Evaluation for LQ45 and IDX30 Indices
marketNews.content: The Indonesia Stock Exchange (BEI) announced a major evaluation for the LQ45 and IDX30 indices, effective from November 1, 2024, to January 31, 2025. Below are the details: LQ45. Included: ADMR, SMRA. Excluded: GGRM, HRUM. IDX30. Included: MAPI, MBMA. Excluded: BUKA, ITMG.

tickerNews.title: MSTI Books Strong Net Profit in 3Q24, Exceeding Expectations
tickerNews.content: Mastersystem Infotama (MSTI) posted a strong net profit of 149 billion rupiah in 3Q24 (+79% YoY, +155% QoQ). This result brought the net profit for 9M24 to 312 billion rupiah (+63% YoY), equivalent to 59% of Stockbit's FY24 projected net profit. We assess this 9M24 realization as exceeding expectations, considering that MSTI's net profit in 9M23 was only equivalent to 43% of the FY23 realization. In general, the rapid net profit growth was driven by: 1) strong revenue; and 2) efficient operating expenses (opex). MSTI recorded revenue of 1.6 trillion rupiah in 3Q24 (+83% YoY, +119% QoQ), resulting in 9M24 revenue growing +52% YoY to 3.5 trillion rupiah. As we wrote in the 2Q24 performance highlights note, MSTI still has a new contract backlog of 2.4 trillion rupiah that had not been booked as revenue as of 1H24 and began to be booked in 3Q24. MSTI management itself provided a revenue growth guidance of +19-24% during FY24. On the other hand, the gross profit margin decreased to 15.8% in 3Q24 (vs. 3Q23: 21%, 2Q24: 19.1%). We expect this lower margin to possibly be caused by large projects with relatively smaller margins. However, we assess that the large contract value has a positive aspect from the opex side, reflected in overall opex efficiency. Opex in 3Q24 was recorded at only 78 billion rupiah (+17% YoY, +6% QoQ), growing much slower compared to the increase in revenue. As a bonus, MSTI also booked other income of 21 billion rupiah in 3Q24 (3Q23: 1 billion rupiah, 2Q24: 4 billion rupiah), which we estimate is related to the reversal of impairment provision expense for receivables. MSTI will hold an earnings call soon, where we will confirm the dynamics of the gross margin and opex mentioned above, as well as the progress of new contracts obtained by the company. Key Takeaway As we wrote in the 3Q24 Stock Ideas, MSTI's performance is expected to accelerate in 2H24, which is reflected in the 3Q24 performance realization. Although it is difficult to predict the specific 4Q24 net profit realization due to seasonality in the company's business, we are confident that our net profit estimate of 531 billion rupiah will be achieved or even exceeded. Based on our FY24 net profit estimate, MSTI is trading at a P/E valuation of 9.1x, a level that we consider attractive.

tickerNews.title: JPFA: 9M24 Net Profit of IDR 2.1 Trillion, Exceeding Expectations
tickerNews.content: JPFA: Japfa Comfeed Indonesia recorded a net profit of 617 billion rupiah (-24% QoQ, -28% YoY) in 3Q24. This result brought the net profit for 9M24 to 2.1 trillion rupiah (vs. 9M23: profit of 937 billion rupiah), exceeding expectations as it is equivalent to 77%/89% of FY24F Stockbit/consensus estimates. The decline in net profit in 3Q24 was triggered by weakening operating profit margins in almost all segments, except Aquaculture. Operating profit in the Feed segment fell to 650 billion rupiah (-5% QoQ, -22% YoY) in 3Q24, with the DOC segment's operating profit also weakening to 377 billion rupiah (-18% QoQ, -36% YoY). Meanwhile, the Broiler business segment incurred a loss of 16 billion rupiah in 3Q24 (vs. 2Q24: profit of 389 billion rupiah, 3Q23: loss of 129 billion rupiah).

tickerNews.title: WINS: 9M24 Net Profit Hits US$19.7 Million, Inline with Expectations; Announces Interim Dividend
tickerNews.content: WINS: Wintermar Offshore Marine recorded a net profit of US$6.3 million (+264% YoY, -44% QoQ) in 3Q24. This result brought the net profit for 9M24 to US$19.7 million (+605% YoY), in line with expectations as it is equivalent to 70.5% of Stockbit's FY24F estimate. In 3Q24, revenue growth (+17% QoQ, +16% YoY) was contributed by an increase in revenue from the Owned Vessel segment (+35% QoQ, +30% YoY) along with an increase in average tariff rates (+23% QoQ, +40% YoY). At the operational level, operating profit in 3Q24 reached US$6 million (+99% QoQ, +119% YoY). The quarterly decline in net profit in 3Q24 was due to a high-base effect resulting from a US$17.4 million one-off gain from the sale of 3 vessels in 2Q24. WINS will distribute an interim dividend for the 2024 fiscal year of 8 rupiah per share with a cum-dividend in the regular and negotiated market on November 5, 2024, indicating a dividend yield of 1.4% as of Monday (28/10).

tickerNews.title: BSSR to Distribute US$30 Million Interim Dividend for FY2024
tickerNews.content: BSSR: Baramulti Suksessarana will distribute an interim dividend for the 2024 fiscal year amounting to US$30 million or US$0.01146, equivalent to 180 rupiah per share assuming an exchange rate of 15,729 rupiah to the US dollar. The cum-dividend date in the regular and negotiated market is November 5, 2024, with payment on November 21, 2024. Referring to the BSSR share price on Monday (28/10) at 4,650 rupiah per share, the indicative dividend yield is 3.9%.

tickerNews.title: PGEO 9M24 Net Profit at US$134 Million, Supported by Higher Financial Income
tickerNews.content: PGEO: Pertamina Geothermal Energy recorded a net profit of US$38 million (-7% YoY, -23% QoQ) in 3Q24, pressured by an exchange rate difference loss of US$4 million (vs. 3Q23: profit of US$2 million, 2Q24: profit of US$12 million). This result brought the net profit for 9M24 to US$134 million (+0.4% YoY), equivalent to 84% of the consensus FY24F estimate. Although appearing to exceed expectations, this result was driven by larger financial income during 9M24. At the operational level, operating profit for 9M24 reached US$171 million (-5% YoY), slightly below expectations as it was equivalent to 73% of the consensus FY24F estimate. Furthermore, the EBITDA margin for 9M24 fell to 83.1% (-140 bps YoY) along with an increase in the cost of revenue (+5% YoY).

tickerNews.title: DOID Subsidiary Signs Major Coal Mining Services Amendment with BYAN Subsidiary
tickerNews.content: DOID: Delta Dunia Makmur's subsidiary, PT Bukit Makmur Mandiri Utama, signed an amendment to a coal mining services provision agreement for PT Indonesia Pratama, a subsidiary of Bayan Resources (BYAN). The agreement is effective from 2024 until 2035, with estimated overburden removal reaching 1.827 billion bcm and estimated coal production of 465 million tons. The agreement represents an increase in production volume from the current level, although DOID did not specify how much this increase is compared to the previous agreement. This agreement amendment will contribute to PT Bukit Makmur Mandiri Utama's revenue up to approximately 107.8 trillion rupiah or US$7.7 billion.

tickerNews.title: ARTO 3Q24 Net Profit Jumps 267% YoY to IDR 35.9 Billion
tickerNews.content: ARTO: Bank Jago recorded a net profit of 35.9 billion rupiah (+27% QoQ, +267% YoY) in 3Q24. This result brought the net profit for 9M24 to 85.8 billion rupiah (+71% YoY), equivalent to 70% of the consensus FY24 estimate. The net profit in 3Q24 was driven by a decrease in provision expense (-12% QoQ, -37% YoY) and growth in Non-Interest Income (+8.3% QoQ, +81% YoY). On the top-line, ARTO booked Net Interest Income (NII) of 369 billion rupiah (+1.6% QoQ, -2% YoY) in 3Q24, resulting in NII over 9M24 reaching 1.1 trillion rupiah (-11% YoY).

tickerNews.title: CMRY 9M24 Net Profit Climbs 19.7% YoY to IDR 1.2 Trillion
tickerNews.content: CMRY: Cisarua Mountain Dairy recorded a net profit of 353 billion rupiah (+2.6% YoY, -15% QoQ). This result brought the net profit for 9M24 to 1.2 trillion rupiah (+19.7% YoY), equivalent to 76% of the consensus FY24F estimate. Operationally, revenue growth (+13.1% YoY, -1.2% QoQ) and gross profit margin expansion to 45.5% (+310 bps YoY, +70 bps QoQ) in 3Q24 pushed operating profit up to 496 billion rupiah (+24% YoY, +10.9% QoQ). However, quarterly net profit growth was suppressed by finance costs of 63 billion rupiah in 3Q24, reversing from finance income of 84 billion rupiah in 2Q24 and 28 billion rupiah in 3Q23.

tickerNews.title: BFIN 3Q24 Net Profit Rises 31% YoY to IDR 429 Billion, Driven by Provision Expense Reduction
tickerNews.content: BFIN: BFI Finance Indonesia recorded a net profit of 429 billion rupiah (+32% QoQ, +31% YoY) in 3Q24. This result brought the net profit for 9M24 to 1.1 trillion rupiah (-5.2% YoY), equivalent to 75% of the consensus FY24F estimate. Revenue was relatively flat in 3Q24 at 1.6 trillion rupiah (+3% QoQ, +2% YoY), so revenue over 9M24 reached 4.7 trillion rupiah (-1.2% YoY). The growth in net profit in 3Q24 was mainly driven by a decrease in provision expenses (CKPN) to 178 billion rupiah (-25.5% QoQ, -36.5% YoY) in 3Q24, resulting in a decrease over 9M24 to 663 billion rupiah (-9% YoY).

tickerNews.title: PTPP 9M24 Net Profit Up 12% YoY to IDR 267.3 Billion, Quarterly Surge Due to Tax Rate Drop and Minority Investor Loss Allocation
tickerNews.content: PTPP: PT PP recorded a net profit of 120.3 billion rupiah (+130% QoQ, -16% YoY) in 3Q24. This result brought the net profit for 9M24 to 267.3 billion rupiah (+12% YoY), equivalent to 71% of the consensus FY24F estimate. The quarterly surge in net profit in 3Q24 was driven by: 1) a slight increase in interest and finance expenses (+4.3% QoQ); 2) an effective tax rate that dropped -13 percentage points QoQ; and 3) a larger portion of net profit allocated to the parent entity due to swelling losses on projects where PTPP was a minority investor. Revenue for 9M24 reached 14 trillion rupiah (+15% YoY), with the gross profit margin declining to 11.8% (vs. 9M23: 14%).

tickerNews.title: ERAL 3Q24 Performance Rebounds, 9M24 Net Profit Decreases Slightly by 3.9% YoY
tickerNews.content: ERAL: Sinar Eka Selaras recorded a net profit of 67 billion rupiah (+14% YoY, +36% QoQ) in 3Q24. This result brought the net profit for 9M24 to 157 billion rupiah (-3.9% YoY). The 3Q24 performance improved compared to the previous 2 quarters (vs. 1Q24: -20% YoY, 2Q24: -9% YoY), mainly caused by increased revenue (+38% YoY, +29% QoQ) and a rise in the gross profit margin to 14.2% (vs. 1Q24: 12.5%, 2Q24: 14%).

tickerNews.title: BREN Subsidiary Awards Mitsubishi Power Contract for Geothermal Plant Retrofit
tickerNews.content: BREN: Barito Renewables Energy, through its subsidiary, Star Energy Geothermal Darajat II, Ltd., awarded a contract to Mitsubishi Power for the retrofit service of the Darajat Geothermal Power Plant unit 3, which will increase its capacity from 121 MW to 129 MW. In the contract, Mitsubishi Power will upgrade the steam turbine and related equipment, with completion targeted for 3Q26.

tickerNews.title: RAJA Signs Credit Facility with BMRI for Investment and Project Funding
tickerNews.content: RAJA: Rukun Raharja signed a credit facility from Bank Mandiri (BMRI) consisting of a term loan facility of up to US$25 million and a bank guarantee facility of up to 60 billion rupiah. In addition, RAJA's subsidiary, PT Triguna Internusa Pratama, also signed an investment credit facility of up to US$19.8 million and an interest during construction investment credit facility of up to US$800,000 from BMRI. The loans are intended for investment needs and project funding.

tickerNews.title: Government to Formulate Rescue Scheme for SRIL to Prioritize Employee Retention
tickerNews.content: Minister of Industry, Agus Gumiwang Kartasasmita, stated that President Prabowo Subianto has ordered the Ministry of Industry, Ministry of Finance, Ministry of State-Owned Enterprises, and Ministry of Manpower to immediately review several options and rescue schemes for Sri Rejeki Isman (SRIL). Agus explained that the government's current priority is to save SRIL employees from layoffs (PHK). The options and rescue schemes for SRIL will be submitted by the government as soon as possible, after the four ministries complete formulating the rescue method. Meanwhile, SRIL stated in a clarification to the IDX that the company has appointed legal counsel to file for cassation against the homologation cancellation ruling that resulted in the company being declared bankrupt by the Semarang District Court. Aside from these legal efforts, SRIL mentioned that the company is still carrying out its activities.
